question.para: Do I need to keep the source after installing?

answer.para: No. You should delete the source after installing. The source is only useful for reinstalling without recompiling. To recompile, always delete the old source and start fresh because "make clean" and friends are not always trustworthy. Deleting compiled source trees also frees considerable disk space.
Here's an example: tar xvjf foo-0.0.tar.bz2 cd foo-0.0 ./configure --prefix=/usr make make install cd .. rm -rf foo-0.0
